body:
Comment 4: 
There's a full stack trace showing exactly what the process was doing when it broke.
There are no questions about where it failed.

I wondered if it might be something else because there was apparently a lot of memory
left (didn't imagine godoc would take ~500MB RSS so quickly), and the way Go is mapping
memory in exactly *that* location is not entirely orthodox, as the error message gives a
hint of.
